title.narrative: OUTPUT 26: SOCIAL ACCOUNTABILITY

description.narrative: Effective tools and dialogue are in place to improved national social accountability, which contributes to Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, poor children benefit from inclusive development being a central objective of national and sectoral policies

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Effective tools and dialogue are in place to improved national social accountability

description.narrative: Dialogue between government and citizens was enhanced through the adoption and use of social accountability tools and space: the 2020 District League Table Report was launched in partnership with the NDPC, generating significant media discussions and advocacy around equitable resource allocation,;and;NDPC pledged to use the Report extensively to ensure MDAs and MMDAs address the reported inequalities in service delivery; a social accountability PFM template and a community scorecard were developed;;trainings were conducted in budget analysis and tracking; and young innovators were supported to develop innovative solutions for the district composite budgets. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2022

title.narrative: Citizens (including children) empowered to participate in (sub)national budget process to improve budget transparency and accountability , Text

National tools and data on district level social development outcomes available and used by both governement and civil society to track progress and promote greater accountability(53062)

target.value: 2021:Use of data to assess district level social development for dialgoue between the government and citizens

title.narrative: Policies and programmes are influenced by analysis and advocacy to reduce child poverty, Text

baseline.value: Resource allocation not addressing geographical disparities

target.value: 2022:Policies and programmes influenced by analysis and advocacy

actual.value: 2021:The 2020 District League Table was launched on 16th December, attarcting significant media coverage and discussions; the Report was widely disseminated to all MMDAs across the country
